quotes: Melinda Gates was born as Melinda Ann French on August 15, 1964.
In early 2019, Gates published her first book entitled, The Moment of Lift: How Empowering Women Changes the World.
Joining the team in 1987, Gates was the youngest recruit and the only woman in her group of ten new employees with business degrees.
She was later promoted to General Manager of Information Products and held that position until she left Microsoft in 1996.

organizations.name: Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation
quotes: As co-chair of the world’s largest private charitable foundation, Melinda Gates is one of the most powerful women in philanthropy. Co-founder of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, she is not only a tech-savvy businesswoman, but she is also an advocate for women’s equality.

organizations.name: Microsoft
quotes: After graduating, Gates was offered a job at IBM, but turned it down to work at a smaller software company called Microsoft.

organizations.name: IBM
quotes: After graduating, Gates was offered a job at IBM, but turned it down to work at a smaller software company called Microsoft.

organizations.name: Ursuline Academy
quotes: Her love for science and technology continued when she attended Ursuline Academy, an all-girls Catholic high school in Dallas.

organizations.name: Duke University
quotes: During her senior year, she took a campus tour of Duke University and fell in love with their computer science department.

roles.title: co-chair
quotes: As co-chair of the world’s largest private charitable foundation, Melinda Gates is one of the most powerful women in philanthropy.

roles.title: Co-founder
quotes: Co-founder of the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, she is not only a tech-savvy businesswoman, but she is also an advocate for women’s equality.

roles.title: marketing manager
quotes: She came on as a marketing manager and developed multimedia products such as; Microsoft Cinemania, Publisher, Word, and Expedia.com.

roles.title: General Manager of Information Products
quotes: She was later promoted to General Manager of Information Products and held that position until she left Microsoft in 1996.
The second of four children, Gates grew up in Dallas, Texas with her family.
Four months after she started at Microsoft, Melinda met Bill Gates at a PC Expo trade show in New York City.
